Texts.Chs: 尽管艾肯一族似乎不愿意向像我们这样的有机历史学家透露他们的历史，但对废弃地区的考察使我们能够根据留下的文本进行探索和估计。有个被遗弃的大型城市充满了凝固的石墨堆，它留下了一篇不寻常的记录，似乎提到了某种巨大的地下怪物，以艾肯和其他所谓的“实体”为食。
Texts.Eng: Although the X'i race seems unwilling to divulge their history to organic historians such as us, expeditions into abandoned territory allow us to explore and estimate based on texts left behind. One large abandoned city filled to the brim with mounds of solidified graphite had an unusual journal left behind that appears to mention some

Although the X'i race seems unwilling to divulge their history to organic historians such as us, expeditions into abandoned territory allow us to explore and estimate based on texts left behind. One large abandoned city filled to the brim with mounds of solidified graphite had an unusual journal left behind that appears to mention some sort of enormous underground monster that fed on X'i and other supposed 'entities'.
There was a poor sketch of it, and the only recognizable feature of the animal was a head somehow resembling a Platybelodons from Earth. According to the journal, it used thousands of strawlike tongues to drink the radioactive energy straight out of its prey.
It may also be the culprit behind the mounds of solidified graphite. Of course, there is always the possibility that the graphite mounds are fossilized X'i ancestors. We'll likely know, once we learn how to comprehend the structure of the X'i...and they aren't helpful in this regard.

Texts.Chs: 它也可能是凝固的石墨堆背后的罪魁祸首。当然，也有可能这些石墨堆是艾肯祖先的化石。虽然我们也很想知道如何理解艾肯的构造......而这几坨沥青在这方面没有帮助。
Texts.Eng: It may also be the culprit behind the mounds of solidified graphite. Of course, there is always the possibility that the graphite mounds are fossilized X'i ancestors. We'll likely know, once we learn how to comprehend the structure of the X'i...and they aren't helpful in this regard.

Texts.Chs: 有一张可怜的草图，这种动物唯一可辨认的特征是它的头部，不知何故与地球上的铲齿象相似。根据这篇记录，它用数以千计的稻草般的舌头直接喝掉猎物身上的放射性能量。
Texts.Eng: sort of enormous underground monster that fed on X'i and other supposed 'entities'. There was a poor sketch of it, and the only recognizable feature of the animal was a head somehow resembling a Platybelodons from Earth. According to the journal, it used thousands of strawlike tongues to drink the radioactive energy straight out of its prey.
